participant_1.background:
I look forward to eating at restaurants.
I work 40 hours a week.
I work in a bank.
I am very polite and courteous.
I try to do my job as best as i can.

participant_2.background:
My parents are both over age 100.
I have six brothers.
My wife is legally deaf.
My brother in law runs a major hollywood studio.
I build aquariums for a living.

content.text: Hi, how are you today?
I'm doing well, thanks for asking!
That's good to hear. What do you do for a living?
I'm a professional aquarium builder.
Oh, that sounds really interesting! What's your favorite part of the job?
My favorite part is getting to see my finished aquariums in people's homes. It's so rewarding to see how happy they are with them.
I can imagine! I love watching fish swim around.
Me too! They're so peaceful and calming.
So, how did you get into aquarium building?
I started out as a hobbyist. I built aquariums for my own home and for friends and family. Then I started my own business.
That's great! I'm sure it's a lot of fun.
It is! I love working with my hands and creating something beautiful.
What's the biggest aquarium you've ever built?
The biggest aquarium I've ever built was for a private residence. It was a 10,000-gallon aquarium with a variety of fish, corals, and other marine life.
Wow! That must have been a lot of work.
It was! But it was also a lot of fun. I'm really proud of how it turned out.
I'm sure it was amazing.
Thanks!
So, what are some of the challenges of being an aquarium builder?
The biggest challenge is working with live animals. You have to be very careful and make sure that they're comfortable and safe.
I can imagine!
Another challenge is dealing with the logistics of building a large aquarium. It can be difficult to transport and install.
I'm sure it can be.
But overall, it's a very rewarding job. I love being able to create something beautiful and that brings people joy.
That's great!
Thanks!
